result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie J Burk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

AODA and any follow through.

DNA sample.

No objection to transfer of Probation.

records.addlTxt: Probable Cause Found
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 10:04 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF2 and 22CF684. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Jack Mathie. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
Waiver of Prelims have been filed in both cases; Court addresses that at this time: 
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; 

State moves to: 
22CF2 -- 
Ct.2(Possession of THC/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.3(Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>DRI.

22CF684 --
Ct.1(Possession of Methamphetamine)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CF2 -- 
Ct.1(Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.
Ct.4(Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made,  a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct.1>> SWH for 2 years probation, to run concurrent to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and any follow through.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Ct.4>> SWH for 1 year probation, to run concurrent to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and any follow through.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 43 days credit.
